CONSTRUCTION PROJECT MANAGER
Professional Summary
I am a sports person by heart and a Civil engineer by profession.
I am currently pursuing Master's in Civil Engineering at Auburn University.
I am a seasoned construction professional with exceptional leadership and project management skills.
Competent in team, budget and schedule oversight.
Able to develop scopes, check field activities and update clients making me the perfect candidate for project management.
I hold sports close to my heart and make sure to practice it in my daily life.
I have been a national level tennis champion during my college days and am also a Registered tennis coach.
I aspire to run a successful construction management firm in future.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Project Manager

Location: Orlando, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Other, Project Management

Description:
Title: Project Manager – Mechanical Commercial Construction and HVAC Location: Orlando, FL Company Overview:Our client is a leading provider of mechanical commercial construction and HVAC solutions, dedicated to delivering excellence in every project. With a strong commitment to innovation, quality, and client satisfaction, we specialize in both small and large-scale commercial construction ventures ranging from $5000 to $20 million in project size. Our team thrives on collaboration, integrity, and exceeding expectations. Job Description:As a Project Manager, you will play a pivotal role in overseeing and managing our client’s mechanical construction, commercial construction and HVAC projects. We are seeking an experienced professional who is passionate about delivering high-quality results within budget and on schedule. If you have a proven track record of success in project management, experience in the commercial construction and HVAC industry, and proficiency in Procore and Bluebeam software, we want to hear from you. Responsibilities:Lead and manage mechanical construction, commercial construction and HVAC projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and quality standards.Collaborate with internal teams, subcontractors, suppliers, and clients to facilitate seamless project execution and communication.Develop and maintain project schedules, budgets, and resources allocation plans.Conduct regular site visits and inspections to monitor progress, identify potential issues, and implement corrective actions as needed.Manage project documentation, including contracts, drawings, change orders, RFIs, and submittals using Procore and Bluebeam software.Oversee procurement processes, including sourcing materials, negotiating contracts, and managing vendor relationships.Ensure compliance with all regulatory requirements, safety standards, and industry best practices.Provide leadership, guidance, and support to project teams, fostering a positive work environment and culture of accountability.Communicate project status, updates, and milestones to stakeholders, addressing any concerns or inquiries in a timely and professional manner.Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement, innovation, and cost-saving initiatives.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Construction Management, Engineering, or related field.Minimum of 5 years of experience in project management within the mechanical construction, commercial construction or HVAC industry.Primavera is a plusProven track record of successfully managing small and large-scale commercial projects ranging from $5000 to $20 million in project size.Proficiency in Procore and Bluebeam software for project management and document control.Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.Ability to multitask, prioritize workload, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.Knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
